pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:0.4: The sub-chapter on sunshades and sandals
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:0.5: 94. The training rule on not asking permission
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:1.2: At that time the nuns sat down on seats in front of the monks without asking permission.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:1.3: The monks complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:1.4: “How can the nuns sit down on seats in front of the monks without asking permission?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:1.5: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:1.8: “… How can nuns sit down on seats in front of the monks without asking permission?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:1.9: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:1.10: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:1.11: ‘If a nun sits down on a seat in front of a monk without asking permission, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:2.1.6: in front of one who is fully ordained.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:2.1.10: even if she sits down on the ground, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:2.2.1: If she has not asked permission, and she perceives that she has not, and she sits down on a seat, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:2.2.2: If she has not asked permission, but she is unsure if she has, and she sits down on a seat, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:2.2.3: If she has not asked permission, but she perceives that she has, and she sits down on a seat, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:2.2.4: If she has asked permission, but she perceives that she has not, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:2.2.5: If she has asked permission, but she is unsure if she has, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:2.2.6: If she has asked permission, and she perceives that she has, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:2.3.2: if she sits down on the seat after asking permission;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:2.3.6: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:2.3.7: The eleventh training rule is finished.
